question: what is it called when you believe in greek gods
api_result: Belief in the Greek gods is typically referred to as "Hellenism" or "Hellenic Polytheism." This modern religious movement seeks to revive the ancient Greek religious practices and worship of the Greek pantheon. Followers of this faith may also identify their practice under the broader term "Paganism," which encompasses various polytheistic, shamanistic, and pantheistic spiritual or religious traditions.
